New York University Archives
New York University Archives Student Notebook
Glies, Gary
MC.363
.25 linear feet in 1 half manuscript box
circa 1832 This collection consists of one bound volume with handwritten notes in various hands, at least one of which appears to have been a student enrolled at NYU (the notes indicate they document a lecture delivered by an NYU professor, circa 1832). Some clippings and other handwritten notes are laid in. Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.
Scope and Contents
This collection consists of one bound volume with handwritten notes in various hands, at least one of which appears to have been a student enrolled at NYU (the notes indicate they document a lecture delivered by an NYU professor, circa 1832). Some clippings and other handwritten notes are laid in.
Arrangement
This collection consists of a single item.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Conditions Governing Use
This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by Gary Glies in October 2022; the accession number associated with this gift is 2022.079.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; New York University Archives Student Notebook; MC 363; box number; folder number or item identifier; New York University Archives, New York University.
Processing Information
In the fall of 2022 this item with evidence of mold was cleaned, rehoused in an archival box, and described on the collection-level.
Notebooks College students -- New York (N.Y.) Glies, Gary
